title: 14 Awesome Activities To Try In Alberta This Fall
text:
14 Awesome Activities To Try In Alberta This Fall The Huffington Post Alberta | By Michelle Butterfield ADVERTISEMENT 
September means shoulder season in Alberta, where it's not quite summer, but not yet ski season, either. 
But just because we can no longer frolic near the lake and it's too early to hit the slopes, doesn't mean there's nothing to do in Alberta in the fall. 
Autumn in Alberta means plenty of outdoor activities and fantastic festivals to try. 
We've gathered up a few suggestions, from new food, to nighttime wonders, to magnificent hikes — all perfect ideas to keep you busy while cooler weather heads your way! Close 14 New Things To Try In Alberta This Fall of   Twenty-seven pilots are competing in the Heritage Inn International Balloon Festival in High River, including pilots from Belgium, the UK and the U.S. They’ll be battling it out for a spot at the World Championship 2016 in Japan. We recommend trying to make it out for one of the "night glow" events, however, to witness the beautiful hot-air balloons all lit up. When: Sept. 23-27 More info Beakerhead is one of Calgary's coolest festivals, smashing together art, science and engineering in creative and unique ways that will leave you astounded, delighted and wanting more. At Beakerhead you can try some engineered eats, build a robot, frolic around some giant, illuminated bunnies, and so much more. When: Sept. 16-20 More info Get lost in the wonder of one of the world's largest dark sky preserves in Jasper, Alta. This festival offers events for every level of astronomer -- and every budget, too! Jasper has made a special commitment to protect and preserve the night sky and this festival proves it. Special events include a night with Col. Chris Hadfield, a night of myth busting with the former co-hosts of 'Mythbusters,' and an evening of Symphony Under the Stars. When: Oct. 16-25 More info Can you out-run the Ranch Tracker? For anyone who’s ever wanted the thrill of being a fugitive on the run, this is the game for you. Heritage Ranch in Red Deer offers an intense game that pits you against the Tracker. You have one hour to remain at large and capture all the flags before you’re caught. You are equipped with a map of the area and a compass or GPS. Game on! More info Western Canada is home to some brilliant fashion designers and there's nowhere better to check out their best creations than at Western Canada Fashion Week. You can attend a show, a party, or there's even competitions for those who want to show off their design, hair and makeup skills. When: Sept. 17-26 More info Get your holiday shopping out of the way, while also supporting local artists and finding unique, handmade, one-of-a-kind items. Etsy Calgary: Made In Canada promises an afternoon of excellent browsing and buying in a laid-back, friendly atmosphere. When: Sept. 26 More info The official kick-off to Banff's Winterstart Festival, Bon Appetite Banff is 10 days of culinary exploration in one of Alberta's most picturesque towns. Restaurants in Banff and Lake Louise will offer unique three-course menus, including three options per course, at fixed prices of $27, $37, $47 &$57. When: Nov. 12-22 More info Go behind-the-scenes of some of Calgary's most beloved and intriguing locations as participants around the city throw open their doors for free tours and experiences. You can visit the Animal Services Centre, the SAIT Art Smith Aero Centre, the City of Calgary Asphalt Plant, and more. When: September 26–27 More info If you've never tried an escape room experience, we recommend you remedy that right away. A new company is offering "Calgary's most immersive escape room experience," where participants are locked in a room together and have to solve a series of riddles and puzzles in order to escape. The experience offered by Escape Capers sounds a bit spooky, rather intense, and totally fun. More info The campus of St. Mary's University in Calgary is said to be totally haunted -- what with its spooky water tower and underground tunnels. To celebrate the school's 29th birthday, they're hosting a ghost tour, complete with a birthday cake reception and fireworks display. When: Sept. 18 More info If you've never hiked to see the larch trees in the Bow Valley...what are you waiting for? Sure, you can see some of them from the parkway, but you've never seen Alberta in all its fall glory until you've checked out these beautiful trees close-up. The hike to Larch Valley at Moraine Lake is our favourite at this time of year. More info The thought of climbing through caves might not be for everyone -- especially those who are a bit claustrophobic -- but for those brave enough to try it there's another world to be found near Canmore. Canmore Cave Tours offers several year-round caving experiences that take you through Rats Nest Cave, where you can check out stalactites, stalagmites, animal bones and fossils, and learn about the geology of the picturesque Bow Valley. More info The Royal Bison is an Edmonton-based, twice-a-year festival of the best and quirkiest art, craft and design the city has to offer. It's a great time to get some holiday shopping done, or even pick up a treat for yourself! When: Nov. 27-29 and Dec. 4-6 More info Never thrown an axe before? Well, it's time to fix that! There are currently two different companies that will host your axe-throwing event in Calgary -- perfect for a fun Friday night with friends, a bad-ass bachelorette party, or a great team-building activity for the office. For more information contact either Axe Throwing Calgary or BATL grounds Calgary.  Share
